intended_use: The ExaCath-4 Percutaneous Catheter System is intended for use in percutaneous transluminal cardiovascular procedures to facilitate access and delivery of interventional devices through the vasculature in adult and pediatric patients (â‰¥5 kg body weight).
device_description: The ExaCath-4 Percutaneous Catheter System is a single-patient, single-use vascular access device consisting of: (1) a 4 Fr delivery catheter with radiopaque marker band at the distal tip; (2) a Tuohy-Borst hemostasis valve with flush port and stopcock; (3) a self-sealing loader hemostasis valve; and (4) a guidewire lumen with 0.014-inch compatibility. Catheter body: braided polyurethane construction. Usable length: 45 cm. The device is supplied sterile (EO sterilization) and non-pyrogenic.
sterilization_text: Sterilized using ethylene oxide (EO) per ISO 11135. SAL 10^-6.

extracted_sections.biocompatibility: Materials evaluated per ISO 10993-1. Cytotoxicity and sensitization studies conducted.
extracted_sections.performance_testing: Burst pressure, kink resistance, torque response, and radiopaque visibility testing performed per ASTM F2172.
